glossary.title: Glossary
glossary.para: This is the glossary for the Wolframe Service Development Kit. Although it covers most of the terms used in the Wolframe world, some terms might be skipped if they are rarely used in the SDK context. These terms are explained in the Application Building Manual

glossdef.para: Some reasonable definition here. BTW, this just an example.
The module that executes the scripts of the user application called by the connection handler. An application processor is assigned to exactly one connection handler during its lifetime.

Program or script executed by the application processor. The program or script works with input, output and system calls as only interface to the system. System exceptions, signals and events are handled in the background through yield execution.

Call of a database or another interface provided by the framework and configured by the user. The application procesor program builds an object describing the transaction or task and passes is to the system with a system call. As result an object is returned as result of the call.
Interface for the networking to one client/server connection during its whole lifetime.

Marks the end of the content to be processed by the application processor. End of data is marked with CR LF '.' CR LF or LF '.' LF. For passing lines with a dot '.' at the start of a content line, the client has to escape an LF '.' in the content with LF '.' '.'.
Marks the end of a network input message. End of message is handled by the application processor generator function without showing up to the application processor program (yield execution).
Data passed from the networking framework to the connection handler for processing.
Data passed back to the networking framework from the connection handler as output of processing.
Filters are data structures attached to network input and output to read and write input in a well defined format.
The application server defines this file path where all relative paths defined in the configuration refer to.

The application processor yields execution and gives control back to the connection handler, when it cannot continue execution. The connection handler has to resume with an action returned to the networking framework, that fetches the resources needed by the application processor to continue.
